author: Matthew Balan
title: Canadian Mosque Faces Investigation After Imam Calls For Murder of Jews
text:
Canadian Mosque Faces Investigation After Imam Calls For Murder of Jews by Matthew Balan | 10:23 am, March 24th, 2017 
A Jewish group in Canada filed a police complaint against a mosque in Montreal after video surfaced of a Jordanian imam delivering a sermon there where he called for the slaying of Jews. 
A Thursday report from CBC disclosed that “the sermon took place at the Dar Al-Arqam Mosque in the city’s Saint-Michel neighbourhood on Dec. 23, 2016….The imam in the video is Jordanian cleric Sheikh Muhammad bin Musa Al Nasr.” 
B’nai Brith Canada filed the police complaint on March 20, 2017, according to its YouTube posting of an excerpt from the sermon (see above). CBC quoted the group’s regional director in Quebec, who decried the imam’s quoting of an Islamic hadith: “This is inciting violence, and this is inciting radicalization.” 
CNN’s Jake Tapper zeroed in on the channel’s reporting on the issue in a Friday re-Tweet (see screengrab below): 
The Canadian broadcast outlet also noted that some in the wider Muslim community in Quebec blasted the sermon for directing “hatred towards non-Muslims.” 
CBC later quoted a representative from B’nai Brith Canada, who criticized the city’s police for not acting quickly enough against anti-Jewish hate speech, as it was “the second complaint against a Montreal-area mosque filed with the Montreal police’s hate crime unit in just over 40 days.”
